author: sky.cactus
content: Some applications on chain may be expecting state roots to be available every block so they can validate proofs.  Changing this would break those apps.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you are asking in the abstract about a hypothetical blockchain not burdened by what is, I think a good way to suss out an answer is to ask what happens if you set `N` to infinity (only commit to state diffs, not state roots)?  Git is diffs all the way down and seems to work reasonably well, but it can result in failing to notice a consensus error until long after the split occurred.
